critique: The document is an executive order by President Franklin D. Roosevelt clarifying the meaning of commercial bribery provisions within the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. It aims to reduce confusion and misapprehension regarding these provisions in previously approved codes. The order interprets commercial bribery as giving something of value to influence an employee or agent without the knowledge of their employer or principal. It also clarifies that the order does not interfere with industries dealing with premiums if approved. The document reflects an interventionist approach to economic regulation and executive power.
